items.title: Senior iOS Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=18, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=15, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior iOS Developer at Linux Academy

Remote

KELLER, TEXAS

ENGINEERING

MOBILE

FULL-TIME

Linux Academy is seeking an Senior iOS Developer to support our team and the thousands of students around the world who learn through us and our cloud technology. Our mission is to provide advanced training tools that increase skills and encourage critical thinking for advanced IT professionals. Linux Academy offers a full-featured training library with everything one needs to learn new skills and advance in one’s career path. As we continue to grow at an unprecedented pace, we need to find the best talent around. Come join us and help build our team!

You can expect to architect, develop, test, release, and support all Linux Academy applications within the Apple eco-system. Stay up to date on the latest and greatest Apple-related technologies and look for ways to integrate them for a better user experience.

Your day to day will include:

  • Develop Applications within the Apple Ecosystem
    • Code high-quality Apple products which serve to accessorize, enhance, and expand the educational offerings of Linux Academy and its sister companies
    • Maintain mobile products created throughout the year, not only avoiding tech debt, but keeping a close eye on new features and capabilities which could serve to enhance our mobile apps.
    • Provide student support when the Support team cannot properly assess or assist students with mobile-based tickets
    • Fix bugs and crashes reported by students as well as investigating and prioritizing feature suggestions
    • Maintain friendly, and most importantly, timely, conversations with students until their issue(s) are resolved
  • Maintain Support for Mobile Applications
    • Provide student support when the Support team cannot properly assess or assist students with mobile based tickets
    • Maintain friendly, and most importantly, timely, conversations with students until their issue(s) are resolved

The ideal candidate

  • Intimate knowledge of iOS application lifecycle and the Human Interface Guidelines
  • Proficient in Swift and familiarity with its emerging best practices
  • Experience with integration of REST API’s and JSON
  • Knowledge of mobile architectures, trends, and technologies
  • Working knowledge of mobile design principles
  • Deep familiarity with CocoaTouch, and the frameworks provided therein
  • Trial by fire experience with the more idiosyncratic aspects of developing for the Apple ecosystem
  • Have published at least one original iOS app
  • Must be available to work in office located in Keller, TX or if remote, be available during normal business hours and have a proven track record of working remotely
  • You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship

What’s in it for you?

  • High compensation with great bonus opportunities
  • Three weeks vacation, one week no-notice PTO
  • Health, dental, vision, life insurance provided free to employee; discounted to spouse/family
  • Free drinks/snacks for office-based employees
  • Flexible schedule
  • Simple IRA with non-elective contribution made by Linux Academy, opportunity to make voluntary contribution by employee
  • Satisfaction of helping others grow and learn
  • Opportunity to work with a really exciting, fun team and roll out new projects
  • Compensation increases proportionate to new knowledge gained

At Linux Academy-

  • We support others in their mission to learn and grow.
  • We are committed to changing the world by changing lives.
  • We believe in the curiosity to learn, the vulnerability to try, the persistence to succeed, and the strength of community.
  • We put our students’ futures first.
  • We dedicate ourselves to pushing the boundaries of online learning.
  • If you value these things too we would love to hear more from you.
Apply for job

items.title: iOS Developer (Remote) at X-Team
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=4, mobile=57, go=6, nodejs=15, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=40, java=2, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
iOS Developer (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: X-Team | No office location

Technologies

ios
objective-c
javascript
swift
xcode

Job description

The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

Most important:

  • 3+ years of experience in mobile iOS Development
  • Experience with Objective-C, CSS, Javascript, HTML
  • Experience with JSON, XML, SOAP, REST
  • Experience with server side technologies (Java, NodeJS, PHP)
  • Experience storing and indexing data
  • Knowledge of Swift and Xcode
  • Code optimization and performance improvements
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code

Nice to have:

  • Experience with working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. 
Apply now

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live.

We are also a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. We’ve fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day.

What separates us from our competition is the level of attention and care we give our developers compared to other more "talent"-based solutions. We proactively support them, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker houses around the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies simply place and drop their talent, we provide unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values and lifestyle.

We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people.

Who is X-Team meant for?

Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

Will I get a job immediately after applying?

If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

What kind of opportunities do you provide?

We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

Benefits

  • Get the chance to work with big brands
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses around the world
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads
  • Join our vibrant community
  • We provide up to $2,500 in funding for your growth & wellbeing
  • Gym reimbursement

items.content:
Mac Developer


Toggl

 verified
Do you have experience with **Objective-C** but also feel like you can do so much more? Do you ace remote working and love tackling complex problems head-on with no fear?

If you answered *yes* to both of these questions then wait no more because we've been looking for you. Join us in our quest to create the world's best desktop time tracking app!

Starting salary at **EUR 48,000 annually**.

Take the **short skills test** and see if you fit the Toggl desktop superhero costume.

Free **Toggl t-shirt** for those who do well on the test!
***
**Toggl** is an insanely simple time tracking tool that can be used on a web browser, desktop and mobile phone. You can **work from anywhere** in the world. We have team members in 25+ countries.

More vacancies at **toggl.com/jobs**

See more jobs at Toggl

items.title: iOS Software Engineer at Universe (Brooklyn, NY)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=32, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=23, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
iOS Software Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Company: Universe | Brooklyn, NY

Remote details

Office Location: Brooklyn, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

ios
swift
cloudkit
vapor
kitura

Job description

Build tools that empower and delight.

We believe that the web is better when more people are making it. Universe is built to empower everyone to create their own home on the internet.

We're looking for an iOS developer to help accelerate our mission. You'll take on tasks throughout the stack. You will expand the editor: adding new block types, more complex layouts, and more customizations for each block. You will help build tools that are easy for everyone to understand, so that buying a domain, setting up metadata, and adding pages are super simple. And you will advance our Magic Builder, a personalized design “assistant” that generates a unique site by asking you just a few questions.

Our app is native, taking advantage of the many frameworks Apple gives us. It is built entirely with Swift. The bulk of the user data is stored in CloudKit though we do maintain a few of our own APIs. We're hoping to convert those APIs from node.js to Swift soon, so experience with Vapor or Kitura is a bonus ;). We use programatic autolayout for the majority of our UI. We do believe in Unit Tests, but we don't have enough yet.

This is a full time position and 100% remote. Experience working remotely is definitely a bonus. We offer health benefits and generous vacation because everyone needs to recharge their batteries.

We're looking for someone sharp, internally-driven, and passionate about building powerful tools for everyone. 

Apply now

About Universe

Universe is the first website builder designed for mobile. In under a minute, anyone can make an awesome site on their phone with our breakthrough grid interface. We were part of YC Winter 2018, hit 170,000 sites created, and just closed our Series A.

items.content:
iOS Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Company: MartianCraft | No office location

Technologies

ios
swift
cocoa
cocoa-touch
objective-c

Job description

We are looking for a creative iOS software engineer to join our US-based remote company. We've been crafting custom Mac and iOS software for our clients for over ten years and are adding to our iOS engineering team. This position is open to U.S.-based candidates only. 

Responsibilities
- Design and build advanced applications in Swift and Objective-C
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
- Work with outside data sources and APIs
- Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
- Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
- Cooperate with clients on best practices and approaches

Required Skills
- 5+ years of software development experience on Apple platforms
- Shipping a title to the iTunes App Store.
- Proficient with Swift, Cocoa, Cocoa Touch and Obj-C
- Ability to deliver solid work on tight deadlines while working remotely
- Must be a motivated team player able to work with minimal supervision
- Design-minded
- Strong attention to detail
- Highly motivated self starter
- macOS software development experience a plus
- OpenGL/OpenGL ES experience a plus

Preferred Skills & Experience
- Past remote work experience
- Previous small team experience
- Software consulting or freelancing experience

Details
- Located near Houston, TX, is a plus but not required. Must be able to travel 3-4 times a year to client site in Houston.
- This is a full time employment position
- Paid time off
- Sick leave
- Full medical, dental, and vision
- Matching 401(k)

Apply now

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
Europe

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Tonsser; 10-50 employees; 0-25% remote;

SKILLS:
• Mobile Applications
• iOS development
• Swift

We're looking for a remote senior iOS engineer to help us build and ship new and exciting features for our users. You're a communicative and experienced freelancer who likes to take ownership and work closely with other engineers, designers and product managers.

If you can check the boxes below, you might be the person we're looking for:
* Obsessed with iOS and have worked on the platform intensively for at least 3-5 years.
* Highly proficient in Swift and reactive programming in RxSwift.
* Experienced with best UI practices for iOS.
* Enjoy working with new, awesome open source third party libraries.
* Able to showcase several apps that you are proud of having built.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ AdBlock Serving 65 Million Users..
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=10, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Adblock Serving 65 Million Users..


Adblock


About AdBlock

We are a small team that serves tens of millions of users worldwide. Our main product, AdBlock, has been downloaded 250 million times by users all over the world. Our browser extensions and applications are available in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. Our apps are available in the Apple iOS, MacOS, and Google Play stores.

We are a distributed team spread across North America. While we have a small office in San Francisco, most of our employees work remotely. What unites us is a desire to provide all users with a distraction-free and worry-free Internet experience.

About You
AdBlock is seeking software engineers to join our team to help develop and support our growing roster of products. This role will be responsible for the development of new extensions and applications. Our development cycle is extremely fast. It is common to write code and have it running in production hours later. If you work for us, you will make an impact, immediately.

In addition to the technical requirements listed below, we look for a few of the same traits in all of our employees. Since we are a small, fully distributed team, we are looking for people that are self-motivated, intellectually curious, and willing to take the initiative to get the job done. We also need people that have great communication skills -- frequent and clear communication is of paramount importance.

What You Will Do


* Develop new web extension features, which have the potential to be used by tens of millions of users worldwide

* Maintain and improve AdBlock’s roster of extensions and apps, currently running on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, as well as on iOS, MacOS, and Android devices

* Collaborate with the AdBlock team through our project management, design, version control, and support systems

* Provide meaningful input on the future of our products




Your Qualifications


* History of meticulous development practices, producing clear, well-documented code.

* Able to focus on the big picture and the minute details of your task. Our developers wear many hats, including those of developer, architect, release manager and tester.

* Team player that can explain complex topics to both technical and non-technical team members and end users

* Mastery of vanilla Javascript programming; advanced grasp of HTML and CSS.

* Prior experience in web extension development a plus.

* Five years of related experience.

* Formal background in computer science strongly preferred.

* North America or Central America time zone

* Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the United States.




How to Apply
If you are interested in applying, please:


* Send your resume and links to your work at careers@getadblock.com

* Include a short description of what you can contribute to AdBlock

* Include the title of the position you are applying for and your name in the title




Note: AdBlock is not able to sponsor, obtain, and/or petition for temporary visa status for this role.

See more jobs at Adblock

items.content:
iOS Engineer at Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC

Santa Monica, Remote · Full Time
Skills
iOS Development, Objective-C, Swift
Compensation
$80K–$110K
0.0%–0.25%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

At Stop, Breathe & Think, our mission is to inspire the world to practice mental and emotional wellness every day. Stop, Breathe & Think is the mindfulness & meditation app that helps users navigate the ups and downs of life. We have a unique approach that allows users to check in with their emotions, and then recommends short, guided meditations, yoga and acupressure videos, tuned to how users feel. With over 3.5 million downloads, our personalized meditation and mindfulness experience was voted Best Health App, Webby People’s Voice Award and has been featured by the Today Show, Apple, GQ, Cosmopolitan and more.

Part of our team is based at our LA offices, and the rest work remotely. As we ramp up, we're looking for great engineers who are excited about building awesome mobile and voice based products and care about our mission. This is an opportunity to join an early stage company that has already built a large organic audience in a fast growing category and help define the user experience for the space.

We're looking for great iOS engineers who care about building apps that help people.

Responsibilities:

Work with UX designers, product managers, and company founders to plan and implement new features and capabilities

Expand our existing iOS applications, https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id778848692 and https://itunes.apple.com/US/app/id1215758068

Build new apps from the ground up as we expand

Mentor interns and more junior developers

Work with our API engineers to plan and integrate server-side support for the apps and features you build

Requirements:

3+ years of experience developing iOS apps, with a focus on Swift

Can work in an agile, JIRA-based environment

Have shipped an app where you were a significant contributor

A bonus if you have experience with any of the following: Audio and video streaming, In-app purchases and subscriptions, Building apps for a large, diverse user base

On-site preferred, remote ok as long as you can work during US Pacific Time working hours.

Compensation: Competitive Salary + Equity

items.title: Sr. iOS Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=38, go=0, nodejs=15, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=27, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Sr. iOS Engineer at Scal.io

San Francisco, Remote · Contract
Skills
iOS Development, Swift
Compensation
$60K–$110K
0.05%–2.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Scal.io is a leading software development studio headquartered in downtown San Francisco with remote offices in Orange County and Atlanta. We've designed and developed systems, services and applications used daily by millions of people. From iOS and Android, to web-scale architectures in Javascript and Python, our engineers have worked across all technologies and stacks. We’ve developed software for a broad range of industries in entertainment, e-commerce, education, news, health, financial, media, real estate and government for companies such as Google, Uber, Yahoo, 23andMe, Brit+Co and Digg. We’ve partnered with numerous international organizations, think tanks, and NGOs to develop innovative technology for global markets.

We are currently seeking talented senior level iOS engineer to join our professional, internationally distributed engineering team. This is a full-time remote position.

Required Skills and Experience:

-- 5+ years of iOS development experience
-- 2+ years of Swift experience
-- CocoaPods/Carthage expertise
-- Strong working knowledge of Git (Git Flow, pull requests, etc)
-- Ability to read and understand English software requirements, strong written
-- English, ability to conduct a basic interview in English
-- Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, etc or equivalent experience

Nice To Have Skills and Experience:

-- Functional Reactive Programming experience with RxSwift/RxCocoa
-- Experience with pods: Moya / Alamofire, MarkupKit
-- AWS cloud expertise
-- Continuous Integration experience with CircleCI or similar
-- Backend experience with NodeJS + Hapi or Scala + Finagle
-- Strong Verbal English Skills

Job Perks:

-- Work with a variety of clients including Fortune 500 and leading tech companies
-- Top of Market Pay for the right candidate (in USD)
-- Full-time remote position
-- Flexible working hours
-- Very professional team

Along with your cv, please, send us the links to the relevant code samples (Swift, Javascript, etc) and/or links to recent projects.

We also love likes on our Facebook page if you feel inclined. :)

https://www.facebook.com/ScalioLabs/

We kindly ask agencies not to bother applying.

items.content:
As the iOS Developer you will be one of the first hires in the software team alongside the Android Developer and have the opportunity to put your stamp on a product which is going to be a global disrupter in the AdTech environment. Opportunity to move into a CTO role based on performance and experience.

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
Native iOS development: Swift and Objective-C
Architectural Design Patterns : MVC, MVP, MVVM, VIPER
UNIT testing with XCTEST, UI Tests
Persistence with CORE data
Agile development: design patterns, OOD, emergent architecture, tools like JIRA/Confluence, TDD
Continuous integration and deployment: Git, Bitrise, Fastlane, Jenkins, Go, Travis, etc.
Willingness to collaborate to develop solutions with others in a continuous and iterative delivery cycle
Ability to cope in ambiguity and forge your own path in lockstep with your team
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills: able to inspire and influence team members
Web services, Micro Services, Restful APIs, JSON, SOAP, XML/RPC

Responsibilities:
Encourage standard development environments and workflows
Help the Lead developer optimise all technical processes to ensure documentation is accurate and up to date
Working on the back end of websites and training those more junior to understand the process
Developing new features for our websites
Integrating with third party APIs
Front end development
Assisting the producer with technical specifications and project viability / planning
To support production team with live projects and to support sales and marketing to understand client requirements * Debugging and resolving issues
Improving test coverage, procedure and documentation

Package:
£25-40k basic DOE plus 2x £5k (semi-annual) target based bonus
25 days holiday + bank holidays
25% Christmas Bonus (on monthly basic)
Profit share Regional Bonus after 12 months service
Profit share Company Bonus after 12 months service

The company would consider applicants home-working for an initial period of up to 3 months if you are based outside of London. We will only consider applications from those eligible to work in the UK. Graduates are encouraged to apply.
